comments.body:
Funfact: Both `server` and `Server` are the same, they are *all* factory functions.
Calling `new Server()` only works since returning an `object` type value from a constructor overrides the return value.
See https://github.com/hapijs/hapi/blob/master/lib/index.js#L9

Why remove `ResponseToolkit` here? Per documentation, it seems that some if its members are returned here:

https://github.com/hapijs/hapi/blob/master/API.md#lifecycle-methods

Where would the toolkit signals and toolkit methods come from here?

@saboya not really sure what you're talking about.

If you mean
> a toolkit signal:
h.abandon - abort processing the request.
h.close - abort processing the request and call end() to ensure the response is closed.
h.continue - continue processing the request lifecycle without changing the response.

Then those are all of `symbol` type.

If you mean
> a toolkit method response:
h.response() - wraps a plain response in a response object.
h.redirect() - wraps a plain response with a redirection directive.
h.authenticated() - indicate request authenticated successfully (auth scheme only).
h.unauthenticated() - indicate request failed to authenticate (auth scheme only).

Then those are either of `ResponseObject` or `Auth` type.

The toolkit itself is not the return type, you use the toolkit to return specific `symbol`s or `ResponseObject` or `Auth`.

And as you said
> Per documentation, it seems that some if its members are returned here:

None of it's members types includes the `ResponseToolkit` itself, you do not return the toolkit.
You're correct, that was a misinterpration on my part.
